column4: does anyone know of any good samba guides? i followed one on ubuntuguide.org but I still can't get it to work. when windows users browse my shares it fails authentication, even though they have been added to the samba group and have permission to read/write my shares.
I know the problem
do you know what I am doing wrong?
sudo gedit /etc/samba/smb.conf
ok I have that file open
CTRL K and type security
security=user
change it to security = share
ok, is that all i need to do?
Then try this: sudo /etc/init.d/samba restart
ok ill be back in a minute ill just test it :)
with security = share, you dont have to run any extra commands afterwords though
ok that seems to be working a bit better, but when I access a share it automatically shows up as bonez\Guest as the username, and it's greyed out. I can't change it to any other user
Then change it back to user and then run smbpasswd -a username for whatever users you want added.
that's how I had it before, but i'll try it again now.
But you didn't try smbpasswd -a username I bet
yes I did
just testing now
it's doing the authentication failure problem again.
it shows the username as MYPCNAME\mark (mark is the account I just set an smbpasswd for)
do u have any further ideas?
